description: One of the largest macaw species, the Green-winged Macaw is primarily deep red, with a distinct band of green across the middle of its wings, followed by blue tips. Often called the 'gentle giant.'
temperament: Known for being more docile, gentle, and affectionate than other large macaws. They are still highly intelligent and require a great deal of social interaction.
loudness: Very Loud. Their vocalizations are deep and powerful, and they can be extremely noisy, especially when in a flock or calling for attention.
vocalization: Good talkers, capable of learning words and short sentences, though they may not have the clarity of a Blue and Gold or an Amazon.
dietaryNeeds: A formulated diet supplemented with nuts, fruits, and vegetables is crucial. They need a diet rich in fat to maintain good health.
healthPointers: Can live 60-80+ years. Susceptible to PDD, papillomas, and psittacosis. Their powerful beaks require a constant supply of safe, hard toys to chew.
housing: Needs an exceptionally large and strong cage or an aviary. Minimum cage size: 48"W x 36"D x 72"H. Not suitable for apartment living.
